de.esoco.lib.comm.http

Class HttpResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.lib.comm.http.HttpResponse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.obrel.core.Relatable

    public class HttpResponse
extends org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
    A class that contains the data of an HTTP response and additional response information (like headers) in it's relations.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HttpResponse(HttpStatusCode eStatus, java.io.Reader rResponseData, int nResponseLength)
      Creates a new instance with a certain status code.
      HttpResponse(HttpStatusCode eStatus, java.lang.String sResponseData)
      Creates a new instance with a certain status code and (short) response data as a string.
      HttpResponse(java.io.Reader rResponseData, int nResponseLength)
      Creates a new instance for a successful request with the status code HttpStatusCode.OK.
      HttpResponse(java.lang.String sResponseData)
      Creates a new instance for a successful request from a response data string.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      <T> HttpResponse with(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rType, T rValue)
      A builder-pattern variant of RelatedObject.set(RelationType, Object) which returns this response instance to allow the concatenation of multiple method invocations.
      void write(java.io.OutputStream rOutput)
      Writes this response to the given output stream.
      protected void writeResponseHeader(HttpStatusCode eStatus, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> rResponseHeaders, java.io.Writer rOut)
      Writes the header for an HTTP response with a certain status code to a Writer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpResponse

        public HttpResponse(java.lang.String sResponseData)
        Creates a new instance for a successful request from a response data string. The HTTP status code will be be set to HttpStatusCode.OK.
        Parameters:
        sResponseData - The response data string
        See Also:
        HttpResponse(HttpStatusCode, Reader, int)

      • HttpResponse

        public HttpResponse(java.io.Reader rResponseData,
                    int nResponseLength)
        Creates a new instance for a successful request with the status code HttpStatusCode.OK.
        Parameters:
        rResponseData - A stream reader that provides access to the data of the response body
        nResponseLength - The length of the response data stream
        See Also:
        HttpResponse(HttpStatusCode, Reader, int)

      • HttpResponse

        public HttpResponse(HttpStatusCode eStatus,
                    java.lang.String sResponseData)
        Creates a new instance with a certain status code and (short) response data as a string. For longer response bodies it is recommended to use the constructor with a Reader argument.
        Parameters:
        eStatus - The response status code
        sResponseData - The data of the response body
        See Also:
        HttpResponse(HttpStatusCode, Reader, int)

      • HttpResponse

        public HttpResponse(HttpStatusCode eStatus,
                    java.io.Reader rResponseData,
                    int nResponseLength)
        Creates a new instance with a certain status code. The response data must be provided as a Reader instance. The status code will be set on this instance as a relation with the relation type CommunicationRelationTypes.HTTP_STATUS_CODE.
        Parameters:
        eStatus - The response status code
        rResponseData - A stream reader that provides access to the data of the response body
        nResponseLength - The length of the response data stream

    • Method Detail

      • setHeader

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> setHeader(HttpHeaderTypes.HttpHeaderField eField,
                                                  java.lang.String sValue)
        Sets a header field of this response to a certain value.
        Parameters:
        eField - The header field to set
        sValue - The field value
        Returns:
        The previous header value or NULL for none

      • with

        public <T> HttpResponse with(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rType,
                             T rValue)
        A builder-pattern variant of RelatedObject.set(RelationType, Object) which returns this response instance to allow the concatenation of multiple method invocations.
        Parameters:
        rType - The type of the relation to set
        rValue - The relation value
        Returns:
        This instance for concatenation

      • write

        public void write(java.io.OutputStream rOutput)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes this response to the given output stream.
        Parameters:
        rOutput - The target output stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If writing to the stream fails

      • writeResponseHeader

        protected void writeResponseHeader(HttpStatusCode eStatus,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> rResponseHeaders,
                                   java.io.Writer rOut)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the header for an HTTP response with a certain status code to a Writer.
        Parameters:
        eStatus - The response status
        rResponseHeaders -
        rOut - The output writer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If writing data fails
